rooms.Name: Enchanted Forest
rooms.Description:
Either you've entered a realm of enchantment and legend, or you took one
hell of a long turn at Albuqurque! Whatever the case, you find yourself
walking along a woodland road with some sense of foreboding. A sign points
to the north and says: CAMELOT THIS WAY -------->.

rooms.Name: The High Road to Camelot
rooms.Description:
You find yourself on the high road to Camelot, seat of power of all the Britons.
The road ahead of you looks even less inviting than the portion of road you
are now on, and the road you are now on is making your skin crawl. You cannot
shake the feeling that someone is watching you, but all you see around you
are trees, trees, bushes, and perhaps an ocasional shrubbery.

rooms.Name: The High Road to Camelot
rooms.Description:
You realize now that the woods are having their way with your senses, you feel
as though if you do not see sunlight and blue skies soon you shall surely
go insane! Relax! You're just a few steps away, but you still can't shake
the utterly paranoid feeling you're being watched. Be careful!

rooms.Name: The High Road to Camelot
rooms.Description:
The forest is beginning to thin just a little, but your paranoia is not.
You hope you can make it out of this place as it is really beginning to
give you the creeps. The trees seem younger here, and the bushes and 
shrubberies are more evident than before. There is light ahead.

rooms.Name: The great field
rooms.Description:
You find yourself in a small field clearing, off in the distance you can
make out what appears to be a battlefield and a great shining castle. You
suspect this is the great Camelot. But there seems to be something between
you and it, more like someone...

rooms.Name: The great field
rooms.Description:
You are standing in the center of a great field. Ahead you see Camelot
shining brightly against the panorama. Around you there are signs of 
civilized society, such as: what appears to be a battlefield off to the 
west, and a tournament field to the east. You are comforted by these 
signs of civilization, it makes you just want to stick a sword in someone.

rooms.Name: In front of the city.
rooms.Description:
You see a beautiful shimmering castle of Camelot before you, you are amazed
at its splendor and beauty. High towers raise into the skies and you can
see this fortress is heavily guarded on many levels. You wonder if going in
here for murder, death, and meyhem is really worth it...better send for 
lawyers, guns, and money!!!

rooms.Name: Causeway to Camelot
rooms.Description:
You are in a dark causeway that leads into Camelot, at both entraces there are 
portculluses and you can see within the walls there is a guard house and
barracks.

rooms.Name: End of causeway
rooms.Description:
You are at the end of the causeway that leads into the city of Camelot, not
much of a city really, but you smell the kitchens of the closeby castle and
hear the ringing of the blacksmith working with his iron. So what are you
still doing here? Go on in!

rooms.Name: Guard house
rooms.Description:
This is a guard house built into the very walls of the fortress. You see it
is kept rather neat and orderly, probably because the Captain's office is
right next door. In the middle of the room is a large table with chairs where
the guards may take their meals and rest.

rooms.Name: The City of Camelot
rooms.Description:
You find yourself inside the walled city of Camelot. It's not much of a city
really, just some stands where serfs are selling their wares, and a blacksmithy
for the knights to have their armor repaired.  Set up from the city is
Camelot itelf, a shining silver plated fortress of amazing size and 
beauty.  You can see it is well guarded and there is but one drawbridge to
the north to gain entrance.

rooms.Name: Guard Captain's office
rooms.Description:
You have entered the spartan office of the Captain of the guard. There is a
desk in the middle of the room with neatly stacked papers pertaining to the 
watch rotation and other matters of a guardly nature. You get the impression
the Captain of the Guard is an orderly man.

Exits.Description: You have found what appears to be a locked trap door.

ExtraDescs.Description: You find a keyhole in the center of what looks to be a trapdoor.

rooms.Name: The bunkroom
rooms.Description:
This is a small bunkroom for the guards who are on call, but not on duty.
It has several bunks along the walls, and scattered through the room are
weapons and armors of various types.

rooms.Name: To the watchtowers
rooms.Description:
You find yourself at the bottom of a stone stairway, where it leads, you
can only guess. The oak door is open and there is only a slight torchlight 
wafting up the stone stairway that spirals up as far as you can see. Shall
you ascend it and discover what lay at the top?

rooms.Name: Stairs
rooms.Description: You are on stairs that lead up to the watchtowers.

rooms.Name: Top of the stairs
rooms.Description: *puff* *puff* You've reached the top of the stairs to the watchtowers.

rooms.Name: Western watchtower
rooms.Description:
You are standing at the top of the western tower defenses of the castle. You
can see the forest you wandered through to get here, and even closer, a vast
battlefield with a lone knight sitting in the middle of it. You notice the
shimmering of a lake off to the southwest and make a mental note to explore
that region when you get some time. Meanwhile, you look at the vast
fortifications and anti-siege equipment that lay neatly stacked around you
and you thank whatever deity you worship you didn't have to assault this
castle!

rooms.Name: Hall
rooms.Description:
You are in a hall that is directly above the causeway. There are arrow slits
cut into the stone at regular intervals facing outward (and inward) from
the castle walls.

rooms.Name: Eastern watchtower
rooms.Description:
You've stepped out onto the other watchtower along the eastern side of the
castle. You see more of that battlefield and what appears to be a 
tournament field off to the east. Several knights appear to be practicing for
an upcoming event, perhaps you'll go down and challenge them later.

rooms.Name: A path into the woods.
rooms.Description:
You walk along the wooded path and you get the strange suspicion you are
being watched. You look around you and see nothing but trees, bushes, and
an occasional shrubbery. You feel confident should a Knight who goes NI! 
ask you to bring him a shrubbery, you could complete the task in no time.
But WHO is there?

rooms.Name: Unkempt path
rooms.Description:
You are still on this wooded path that gives you the creeps, could there
be some hidden person around here ready to cut your purse, or perhaps your
throat, or both? You make the call.

rooms.Name: The path
rooms.Description:
You move along the path with more confidence now, that perhaps you are not
being watched, followed, planned for someone's meal, or otherwise thought
ill of. This is probably because you can see a clearing up ahead and you 
figure it may be safer than these blasted woods!

rooms.Name: Clearing
rooms.Description:
You have reached a small clearing in the woods. You are greatful for the
small patch of sky you see above you, but you are curious at the number
of shields hanging on a tree nearby. You wonder who would be nutty enough
to hang so many shields on a tree, then you wish you had saved your 
ponderings as the answer becomes clear...

rooms.Name: A new path
rooms.Description:
You have found another path going into the woods, you wonder where 
it may lead. Should you decide to follow it? I don't know, it was a 
rhetorical question.

rooms.Name: a rock formation
rooms.Description:
The forest is interrupted by a rocky formation jutting out from the ground.
You sense something hidden in the stone, look carefully.

ExtraDescs.Description: You have found a hidden doorway! To open type open hidden.
You have found a hidden doorway! To open type open hidden.
You have found a hidden doorway! To open type open hidden.

rooms.Name: a secret cave
rooms.Description:
You find yourself inside a great cavern. Stalactites and stalagmites are
all around you. As well as some other things you might not be too keen on...

rooms.Name: Merlin's chamber
rooms.Description:
You have stumbled into the private chambers of Merlin. This room is in
quite a state, papers are piled up on workbenches along with books. There
are large star charts on the walls and strange symbols adorn them. There
are many racks of chemicals and half finished experiments that you can only
guess at. In one corner of the room there is a comfortable looking chair
which along the back is perched a rather indignant looking owl, who stares
at you as if your ears just melted and your hair has turned purple.

ExtraDescs.Description:
You find what appears to be a secret door on the north wall, where do you
think the key is?

You find what appears to be a secret door on the north wall, where do you
think the key is?

You find what appears to be a secret door on the north wall, where do you
think the key is?

rooms.Name: A strange room
rooms.Description:
You have no idea what this room is for. Along one entire wall there is
what appears to be a giant mirror. When you touch it's surface your hand
goes through it and a liquid-like ripple appears across it. You wonder 
where stepping through this thing will take you...?

rooms.Name: Morgan's chamber
rooms.Description:
This is the not so hidden chambers of Morgan Le Fay. All around you there
are tables and benches covered with various notes and grimores. There are
racks of chemical compounds you can only guess at, and large charts cover
the stone walls. There are many things that appear to be defying the laws
of gravity as you know it such as a hourglass with the sand going up instead
of down, and a rope that seems to be suspending itself in the air. You
puzzle over this until you notice you're not alone in the room.

rooms.Name: To the tournement grounds.
rooms.Description: Off to the east lay the tournement grounds.

rooms.Name: The tournement grounds
rooms.Description:
You find yourself in the middle of a long field decorated with many flags
and banners. You see crude benches along the sides and an elevated platform
where the king and his court may watch. You correctly deduce that this is
a tournament field where brave knights battle each other for honor, glory, and
maybe even the kiss of a fair maiden...(WOO WOO!).

rooms.Name: The great field
rooms.Description:
You see a great field scarred with many battles, what remaining grass grows
in wasted clumps along with many poppies. The ground seems littered with the
remains of battles and campfires long since forgotten except in songs of
old.

rooms.Name: The field
rooms.Description:
You are now walking through the great battle field in front and to the
west of Camelot. You see many ruined weapons of carnage and destruction which
lay where they fell. Many things appear to have been the victims of 
scavengers. An occasional bone will stick out through the ground filling 
your bones with a chill. You wonder how many brave warriors came to an
untimely death apon this field.

rooms.Name: across the field
rooms.Description:
The great battlefield is being retaken by the forests ahead. You see the
same woods you followed not too long ago to reach Camelot before you. A 
crude path has been cut into them and leads off to the south. You must
now decide which way will lead you to glory and meyhem.

rooms.Name: Entering the forest
rooms.Description:
The trees are beginning to get dense, as is the underbrush. You see a slight
trail has been worn into the ground here.

rooms.Name: a forest trail
rooms.Description: You find yourself on a narrow forest trail, up ahead you see a clearing.

rooms.Name: The lake
rooms.Description:
This is the legendary lake where Arthur first held Excalibur in his hands, be
careful, as the lady of the lake protects her domain with a vengance!

rooms.Name: a path around the lake
rooms.Description: There is a path around the lake to the west, if you dare...

rooms.Name: around the lake
rooms.Description:
You find yourself on the shores of a lake and can either go into the forest or
around the lake.

rooms.Name: Before the castle
rooms.Description:
You are heading in the general direction of the castle drawbridge, there are
of course, many distractions between here and there.

rooms.Name: In front of the drawbridge
rooms.Description:
You stand before a open drawbridge to the shining castle of Camelot. You are
awed by it's size and beauty, you wonder if you dare enter such an amazing
structure.

rooms.Name: The Royal Stables.
rooms.Description:
Two things immediately tell you where you are. The first is your keen 
sense of smell, which recognizes the odor of animals, hay, and manure. 
The other clue is that you just stepped into a nice, fresh, clump of 
something warm and smelly. This is decidedly not the most pleasant 
place to stick around, but to each their own!

rooms.Name: The smithy
rooms.Description:
You've entered the blacksmith's work area.  It's hot and musky in here, you
can see weapons and implements of all kinds in various stages of completetion.

rooms.Name: Inside the Castle walls
rooms.Description:
You have entered the actual walls of the castle now, you see they are very 
thick. There are all sorts of materials for defending the castle stacked 
up around you and you see it is the sort of place that is well guarded.

rooms.Name: The Antechamber
rooms.Description:
You have entered a large room with only one entrance and one exit.  It was
designed to be defensible should an enemy manage to get this far into the
castle.

rooms.Name: The Squire's chambers
rooms.Description:
This is the chambers where all the many knight's squires may rest from their
duties, for a squire may be called upon at any time day or night to run for
his master.  The pages also reside here, usually on the floor.

rooms.Name: The Royal Guard's chambers
rooms.Description:
You have entered the chambers of the Kings elite Royal Guard.  It is an orderly
sort of place, there are several beds and a big table for the guards to take
their meals.  Neatly hung on racks and pegs are the Guard's implements of 
destruction, should someone need a little incentive for treating these
guys with respect.

rooms.Name: The East tower
rooms.Description:
This appears to be a small tower area which might be an excellent platform
for shooting arrows at an approaching enemy. You can deduce this because there
is a rack with arrows on it along the wall and many long narrow slits which 
face away from the castle.

rooms.Name: The main hall
rooms.Description:
You have entered the main hall of the castle of Camelot. All around
you are signs of the royalty and riches of the land of the Britons.
Bright tapestries adorn the walls, as do fine works of armor and weapontry.
You are amazed at the high butresses, columns, and arches that make up
the interior construction of the castle. You have many choices as to a
direction to choose, so pick well.

rooms.Name: Banquet hall
rooms.Description:
This is a large room with several long tables in it.  On the walls are 
beautiful tapestries and war banners from long ago campaigns.  In the center
of the room is the most beautiful round table you have ever seen, you conclude
you have indeed found the residence of the fabled Knights of the Round Table.

rooms.Name: Eastern hall
rooms.Description:
You find yourself in an exquisite hallway. The walls are of solid polished 
granite, the torches hang in guilded holders, and the floor is clean polished
stone with beautiful carpets along the middle path. The doors are made of
the finest oak and are banded with black iron. You admire the sheer design
before you go on to create more havok and mayhem.

rooms.Name: Western hall
rooms.Description:
You enter yet another section of the hallway, above you is an archway and
column design that you surmise gives the castle more support. You see 
similar features as before, except there are three doors instead of 2.

rooms.Name: The staircase
rooms.Description:
You are on a beautiful starcase that winds around both sides of the northern
doors, where does it go? Keep climbing and find out.

rooms.Name: The library
rooms.Description:
This is the King's library, contrary to popular belief, he loves to read.
The shelves go all the way to the ceiling and cover all four walls, except
for the large fireplace. There is a long table along the middle and several
comfortable chairs near the fireplace where one can read by firelight.

rooms.Name: Throne Room
rooms.Description:
This is King Arthur and Queen Guinevere's Throne room. The dust everywhere
leads you to believe that it is not used very often. There are huge banners
and tapestries along the walls and suits of ceremonial armor in the spaces
in between. On a raised dias along the far wall sit two charis which you expect
you will find empty, however, one of them seems to be occupied...

ExtraDescs.Description:
You find a keyhole on the floor next to the King's throne. If you have the
proper key unlock secret and open secret will do the trick.

rooms.Name: The main kitchen
rooms.Description:
You have entered the main kitchen, you smell all sorts of strange and wonderful
foods around you. There are huge hearths with bubbling cauldrens of food 
being prepared. Spices and wine lay  scattered about the work area. Utensils
of all sorts hang from racks above your head, plates and dinner ware are
also in evidence. You think you might want to stay a bit and grab a snack,
of course the cook might not like it.

rooms.Name: a forest path
rooms.Description:
You find yourself facing a forest path that leads into the unknown, you wonder
where it might take you, only one way to find out. The trees begin to surround
you and you feel the hair on the back of your neck prickling up as if there
is some hidden dangers lurking just out of sight behind the trees and 
shrubbery.

rooms.Name: The King's Treasury
rooms.Description: This is the King's treasury, it is full of impressive and untold riches.

rooms.Name: The Queen's sitting room
rooms.Description:
This is where Queen Guinevere and her ladies in waiting may sit and entertain
female guests of personage while the men get drunk and carouse next door.
There is an abundance of horrid romance novels and poetry books along the wall
and embroidery hoops and sewing equipment laying in neat stacks. An exquisite
silver tea service stands ready in the corner of the room by the huge stone
fireplace where the ladies may keep warm and see to sew.

rooms.Name: Eastern staircase
rooms.Description:
You have chosen the eastern staircase, you can see the landing to the east
wing ahead.

rooms.Name: Western staircase
rooms.Description: You have chosen the western staircase, ahead you can see the second floor.

rooms.Name: East wing
rooms.Description:
You have entered a long hall that is the second floor to the east wing. Torches
line the walls periodically giving off a faint, erie light that makes the 
flagstones look dark and forbidding. There are also some large oak doors 
along the hall.

rooms.Name: East wing hall
rooms.Description:
You are in the east wing hall, you see torches and doors and a dead end down
a ways.

rooms.Name: further along the east wing
rooms.Description:
You find yourself further along the east wing, there are doors to either side
of you.

rooms.Name: The end of the east wing
rooms.Description:
The east wing comes to an end here, there is a tapestry on the wall in front
of you, it is a beautiful dragon design.

rooms.Name: Guest room
rooms.Description:
You have found what appears to be a guest room, there is a lavish canopy
bed, fine carpets on the floor, and a huge fireplace and mantle. The window
looks out over the castle walls.

rooms.Name: Another guest room
rooms.Description: You find yet another guest room, this one appears to be lived in...

rooms.Name: Lancelot's room
rooms.Description:
It appears the Queen's champion has a room of his very own, although he
seems hardly to ever use it, do you wonder why?

rooms.Name: To the Dungeons
rooms.Description:
This is a processing room for those deemed the King's enemies. There is a
large table where prisoners are stripped of any personal belongings and sent
further below.

rooms.Name: The entrance to the Dungeon
rooms.Description:
You stand before a great oaken door to the south, you conclude you must be
entering the very pits of hell from the screams you hear within.

rooms.Name: The cell block
rooms.Description:
You have entered the cell block itself, there are doors to your right and l
left and more as you look down the hall. You hear screams coming from the 
door all the way to the south.

rooms.Name: The torture room
rooms.Description:
You enter a room that sickens you. Grisly machines of human torture are all
around you, bits of gore and blood are imbedded in some of them. The room 
reeks of blood and decay. You feel compelled to kill whomever would gain some
pleasure out of doing this to other people.

ExtraDescs.Description: You find a keyhole in the center of what looks to be a trapdoor

rooms.Name: Secret tunnel
rooms.Description:
You have entered a dark tunnel, you can see a trapdoor above you and a yawning
blackness awaiting you to the south.

rooms.Name: tunnel
rooms.Description: further along the tunnel.

rooms.Name: tunnel
rooms.Description: Further along the tunnel

rooms.Name: tunnel
rooms.Description:
You are still in the tunnel, the darkness grows as you move north. The glow
to the south is becoming most prominant.

rooms.Name: tunnel
rooms.Description:
The tunnel is opening up to the south, you are approaching what looks like a
natural cave fissure in the rock. The glow is also coming from that cave.

rooms.Name: The crystal cave
rooms.Description:
This is the crystal cave that will ultimately become Merlin's prison for all
eternity. Unfortunately he's not here yet, so those events must not have 
happened, however, something else seems to be here...

rooms.Name: Crystal treasure room
rooms.Description:
You find yourself slipping on the descent and falling onto a bed of razor
sharp crystals, you are decorated like a crystal porcupine...sorry!

rooms.Name: The tunnel
rooms.Description:
You are continuing along the tunnel, it slopes upward as you go south, downward
as you go north. You can see a shimmering light from the north.

rooms.Name: tunnel
rooms.Description: You are continuing along the tunnel

rooms.Name: tunnel
rooms.Description: You are continuing along the tunnel

rooms.Name: The secret tunnel
rooms.Description:
You have entered a secret tunnel, it appears to go off in a northerly
direction.

rooms.Name: Top of the Western Staircase
rooms.Description:
You have reached the top of the western staircase, you see several doors
along a hall lit with torches.

rooms.Name: Along the west wing
rooms.Description:
You find yourself in the hall of the west wing, this hall is meant to be
highly defensible as it would be perhaps the spot of the last fight for the
castle. There are more torches on the walls and some nice tapestries as well.

rooms.Name: Royal apartments
rooms.Description:
This is the anti-room to the King's Royal chambers. It is tastefully
decorated in early mideval with carpets, a huge fireplace, chairs, a table, and
a desk in the corner. A few tapestries adorn the walls. You can see a 
woman's touch in the decoration and can only assume Guinevere had something
to say about it.

rooms.Name: West wing hall
rooms.Description:
You are in the middle of the west wing hall, torches hang along the walls
and you see some very thick oak doors around you.

rooms.Name: Chamberlain's quarters
rooms.Description:
This is the King's Chamberlain's quarters. He is a very neat man and uptight
as all heck. His room is spartan and orderly. He has a large desk in the
corner near the fireplace from which he plans the king's itinerary.

rooms.Name: Prison cell
rooms.Description: You have no way out of here

rooms.Name: The balcony
rooms.Description:
You step out onto the balcony and smell the sweet mud air. You see that
this whole area is actually a floating island high above Midgarrd. You can
see down to the city and the surrounding areas. You almost imagine people
scurrying around like ants to this adventure or that. An eagle flies by
the sanctuary, breaking the spell of your visual wanderings. You notice
there is actually many deck chairs out here, a cooler stocked with beer,
steaks on the bar-b-que, and a mini-bar in the corner. That seems rather nice.

rooms.Name: Lazarus's Sanctum
rooms.Description:
You have entered a room with wall-to-wall bookshelves neatly cut to allow
for doorways and a fireplace. The fireplace mantle contains many nick-nacks:
A "question authority" pin, a bumper sticker stating: Support Fascism-Vote
Republican, and a few other politically incorrect items of interest. Above
the mantle rests a HOLY AVENGER, onced used by the paladin Lazarus before he
ascended the heavens to his holy loftiness. At the other end of the room is
a console that looks very much like the one in the engineering room of the
USS Enterprise-D, you know this is impossible since it was blown up in the
last movie so you wonder what it is doing there. There is a thick carpet
at your feet and several comfortable looking chairs around the room. There
are several magic portals to realms about the mud.
